events.name: Front End TL;DR July 2015
events.description: Skyscanner, a house hold name for travellers, hosts FEDS TL;DR this month. Many of us are their customers -- now we can catch a glimpse of the talented people behind the app. FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. To enter the building, you need not to register, but just go to 9th floor and look for Ardy. We will host the event at “Borobudur/George Town” room. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi (and grab some food).

events.name: Papers We Love #011
events.description: Paper #1: On computable numbers, with an application to the Entscheidungsproblem : Melvin Zhang - http://www.cs.virginia.edu/~robins/Turing_Paper_1936.pdf Paper #2: Oberon System Implemented on a Low-Cost FPGA Board : Michał - http://www.xilinx.com/publications/archives/xcell/Xcell91.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
